materials.raw_text: K2O (Potassium Oxide) - 120 g, W (Tungsten) - 80 g, Binding Agent (Polymer Resin) - 50 g, Catalyst (Curing Agent) - 10 g, Filler (Silica Sand) - 50 g

sourcing.instructions: K2O can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers. W can be obtained from metal suppliers or specialty alloy retailers. Polymer resin and curing agent are available at craft stores or online. Silica sand can be found at garden supply stores or home improvement stores.
steps: K2O can be sourced from chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers. W can be obtained from metal suppliers or specialty alloy retailers. Polymer resin and curing agent are available at craft stores or online. Silica sand can be found at garden supply stores or home improvement stores.

1. Measure 120 g of K2O and 80 g of W. 2. In a mixing container, combine the K2O and W thoroughly until well blended. 3. Add 50 g of polymer resin to the mixture and blend until uniform. 4. Slowly incorporate 10 g of curing agent and mix thoroughly. 5. Finally, add 50 g of silica sand and mix until there are no dry patches.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 120 g of K2O and 80 g of W. 2. In a mixing container, combine the K2O and W thoroughly until well blended. 3. Add 50 g of polymer resin to the mixture and blend until uniform. 4. Slowly incorporate 10 g of curing agent and mix thoroughly. 5. Finally, add 50 g of silica sand and mix until there are no dry patches.

steps: Preheat the heating equipment to 200째C (392째F). Once the mixture is ready, pour it into a mold of the dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches and place it in the heated equipment for 30 minutes.
heating.raw_text: Preheat the heating equipment to 200째C (392째F). Once the mixture is ready, pour it into a mold of the dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches and place it in the heated equipment for 30 minutes.

steps: After 30 minutes, remove the mold from the heating equipment and allow it to cool at room temperature for 1 hour. Ensure the cooling area is well-ventilated.
cooling.raw_text: After 30 minutes, remove the mold from the heating equipment and allow it to cool at room temperature for 1 hour. Ensure the cooling area is well-ventilated.

steps: Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the mold. If desired, sand the edges to smooth any rough surfaces. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
post_processing.raw_text: Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the mold. If desired, sand the edges to smooth any rough surfaces. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
